Notable deaths of 2013

Pulitzer winner Anthony Lewis dies at 85

Lewis, an author and New York Times columnist, was the husband of retired Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court chief justice Margaret Marshall.

The number of people 45 and older who have been jobless for more than a year has quadrupled since 2007.

The Big Picture

A soldier's eye

Charlie Houghey shot nearly 2,000 images in Vietnam between March 1968 and May 1969 before taking the negatives home. They were just recently recovered after 45 years.
